metadata.title: USN-7162-1 -- curl vulnerability
metadata.description: Harry Sintonen discovered that curl incorrectly handled credentials from .netrc files when following HTTP redirects. In certain configurations, the password for the first host could be leaked to the followed-to host, contrary to expectations.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7162-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  curl - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.20 libcurl3-gnutls - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.20 libcurl3-nss - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.20 libcurl4 - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.20 libcurl4-doc - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.20 libcurl4-gnutls-dev - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.20 libcurl4-nss-dev - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.20 libcurl4-openssl-dev - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.20 No subscription required
